planting.name: Selection of healthy suckers
planting.description: Proper care should be given when planting susceptible cultivators by selecting healthy suckers from disease fields
advantages: Reduces the risk of Panama Wilt

diseases.name: Panama Wilt
diseases.description: Fusarium oxysporum f.sp cubense is a soil borne disease that enters the roots through the fine laterals. The pathogen is easily spread by infected rhizomes or suckers, farm implements or vehicles, irrigation water
symptoms: Externally, the first obvious signs of disease in most varieties are wilting and a light yellow colouring of the lower leaves, most prominent around the margins. They eventually turn a bright yellow colour with dead leaf margins.
Splitting of the pseudo stem base is a characteristic symptom.

When a cross-section is cut, the discolouration appears in a circular pattern around the centre of the rhizome where the infection concentrates due to the arrangement of the vessels. As symptoms progress into the pseudo-stem, continuous lines of discolouration are evident when the plant is cut longitudinally

plantCare.name: Disease Management

diseases.name: Panama Wilt
diseases.description: Fusarium oxysporum f.sp cubense is a soil borne disease that enters the roots through the fine laterals. The pathogen is easily spread by infected rhizomes or suckers, farm implements or vehicles, irrigation water

As symptoms progress into the pseudo-stem, continuous lines of discolouration are evident when the plant is cut longitudinally

supplements.name: Bacillus subtilis
supplements.description: Application Bacillus subtilis bactericide can also be applied along with farmyard manure and neem cake.
supplements.usage: Apply along with farmyard manure and neem cake.

supplements.name: Bacillus subtilis
supplements.description: About 60 mg of Bacillus subtilis (in a capsule) can be applied in a 10 cm deep hole made in the corm.
supplements.usage: Applied in a 10 cm deep hole made in the corm.

supplements.name: Carbofuran
supplements.description: Paring (pralinge removal of roots and outer skin of corm) and dipping of the suckers in clay slurry and sprinkled with Carbofuran granules
supplements.usage: Paring (pralinge removal of roots and outer skin of corm) and dipping of the suckers in clay slurry and sprinkled with Carbofuran granules

supplements.name: Carbendazim
supplements.description: Soil drenching of Carbendazim 0.1 per cent solution around the pseudo stem at bimonthly intervals starting from five months after planting.
supplements.timeOfApplication: Starting from five months after planting
supplements.usage: Soil drenching of Carbendazim 0.1 per cent solution around the pseudo stem at bimonthly intervals starting from five months after planting.

plantCare.usage: Application of Bacillus subtilis, Carbofuran, and Carbendazim

plantCare.name: Sanitation
plantCare.description: Remove and destroy infested plant material after harvest
advantages: Reduces the spread of Panama Wilt

metadata.author: Prompt Optimizer
metadata.notes: Expanded version of schema with added location, season, and temperature fields for regional adaptability and environmental context.

diseases.name: Panama Wilt Disease
diseases.description: a deadly fungal disease in bananas caused by Fusarium oxysporum f. sp. cubense, leading to wilting and plant death. It spreads through soil and water, making prevention crucial.
symptoms: Leaf Yellowing & Wilting - Starts from older leaves and spreads to younger ones.
Uneven Wilting - Some leaves wilt more than others.
Brittle Leaves - Leaves become dry and snap easily.
Pseudostem Splitting - The stalk may crack open.
Plant Death - Disease eventually kills the entire plant

diseases.name: Sigatoka Leaf Spot Disease
diseases.description: a fungal infection that affects banana leaves, reducing photosynthesis and overall yield.
symptoms: Black Sigatoka: Reddish-brown flecks turn into dark streaks, causing leaf die-off.
Yellow Sigatoka: Yellow streaks near leaf edges expand, leading to defoliation.

diseases.name: Anthracnose Disease
diseases.description: a banana major disease that affects both leaves and fruits, causing severe economic losses for farmers.
symptoms: Dark, sunken lesions on leaves, stems, fruits, or flowers
Blight of leaves and shoots
Dieback of twigs and branches
Premature defoliation
Stunted growth, Reduced fruit yield

cure.name: Ensure proper air circulation in plantations
Harvest fruits at the correct maturity stage

diseases.name: Yellow Leaf Disease
diseases.description: This viral disease weakens plants and significantly reduces productivity, making it a serious concern for banana farmers.
symptoms: Yellowing of leaves from edges inward
Reduced growth and fruit production

pests.name: Thrips in Banana
pests.description: tiny insects that suck plant sap, leading to scarring and reduced fruit quality. They thrive in warm, humid conditions and are a major threat to banana crops.
symptoms: Early Signs: Small, water-soaked spots on fruit due to thrips feeding.
Discoloration: Rusty-red or dark brown rough, scabby patches.
Severe Cases: Fruit skin may crack or split.
Market Impact: External damage lowers appeal, causing market rejection.

cure.name: Katyayani Imd-178 Imidacloprid 17.8% SL
cure.description: an effective insecticide for banana plants

cure.name: Maintain field hygiene and remove affected plant parts

pests.name: Cutworm in Banana
pests.description: the larvae of various moth species that cut the stems of young banana plants at the soil surface, leading to plant wilting, damage, and even death
symptoms: Wilting and death of seedlings
Stems cut off at the base
Holes in leaves
Presence of cutworms in the soil

pests.name: Aphids in Banana
pests.description: small, soft-bodied insects that feed on plant sap and spread viral diseases, including banana yellow leaf disease.
symptoms: Distorted Leaves: Aphids suck sap, causing curling, crinkling, or stunted growth.
Yellowing Leaves: Leaves turn pale green or yellow due to sap loss.
Sticky Honeydew: Aphids excrete a sugary substance, attracting ants.
Sooty Mold: Black fungus grows on honeydew, blocking sunlight.

cure.name: Spray Katyayani Nashak (Fipronil 40 % + Imidacloprid 40 % wg) or neem-based solutions
